text: If you want to know how it works in detail, you'd be better off recording full depth virtual prices and examine how it changes when money arrives on the raw offers. You are viewing on the GUI at a depth of 3 based on your screenshots. You might be missing something at the lower levels.. You are trying to equate your ask for £10 at 7.0 with an offer of £44 at 1.56 but I don't see how that makes any sense. How can you be certain that it is not a bot responding to your order in some way??

text:
What I’ve found is that due to constantly changing data in play generally offers larger “edges” but you need to be able to quickly respond and make a sensible decision, you have much more time to execute a decision pre play, but that means the markets are often more efficient. 

So harder to find an edge pre play, but easier to execute. 
Easier to find an edge in play, but harder to execute. 

Also volumes pre play often means you can scale a smaller edge further than you can a large edge in play. At least until someone else realizes what your doing and your thin edge decays :relaxed:

Easier to find an edge in play, but
harder

to execute. 

Also volumes pre play often means you can scale a smaller edge further than you can a large edge in play. At least until someone else realizes what your doing and your thin edge decays
